name: Poker II
overview: Poker II is an unlicensed compilation card game, developed by Thin Chen Co. and published by Sachen, which was released for the Famicom in Japan in 1991. The game pits you against three other computer-controlled players in your choice of four different games. The games available are: Max 2, 99, Ghost-Buster, and Change Around. A second human player can replace one of the three CPU opponents if the menu options are set accordingly.
